greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of forests with n unlabeled vertices and maximum vertex degree k, (0 <= k < n).
comment: A forest is an acyclic graph.
(The component trees here are not rooted. - _N. J. A. Sloane_, Dec 19 2020)
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1275 (rows 1..50)
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Maximum Vertex Degree
program: (PARI) \\ Here V(n, k) gives column k of A144528.
MSet(p,k)={my(n=serprec(p,x)-1); if(min(k,n)<1, 1 + O(x*x^n), polcoef(exp( sum(i=1, min(k,n), (y^i + O(y*y^k))*subst(p + O(x*x^(n\i)), x, x^i)/i ))/(1-y + O(y*y^k)), k, y))}
V(n,k)={my(g=1+O(x)); for(n=2, n, g=x*MSet(g, k-1)); Vec(1 + x*MSet(g, k) + (subst(g, x, x^2) - g^2)/2)}
M(n, m=n)={my(v=vector(m, k, EulerT(V(n,k-1)[2..1+n])~)); Mat(vector(m, k, v[k]-if(k>1, v[k-1])))}
xref: Cf. A144215 (max degree <= k), A144528, A238414 (trees), A263293 (graphs).
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Dec 18 2020
